messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

LGTM The (sic) is cute but may not be necessary. Anybody caring to read that line should know what an EHLO is. On Tue, Mar 26, 2013 at 11:12 AM, wrote: > Reviewers: golang-dev1, > > Message: > Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, > > I'd like you to review this change to > https://code.google.com/p/go > > > Description: > doc/go1.1.html: net/mail, net/smtp > > Please review this at https://codereview.appspot.**com/7835049/ > > Affected files: > M doc/go1.1.html > > > Index: doc/go1.1.html > ==============================**==============================**======= > --- a/doc/go1.1.html > +++ b/doc/go1.1.html > @@ -837,12 +837,19 @@ > The new net/http/cookiejar > package provides the basics for managing HTTP cookies. > > > -
  • TODO: > -net/mail: ParseAddress, ParseAddressList > +
  • > +The **net/mail package has two > new functions, > +**ParseAddress > and > +** > ParseAddressList, > +to parse RFC 5322-formatted mail addresses into > +**Address structures. >
    • > > -
  • TODO: > -net/smtp: Client.Hello > +
  • > +The **net/smtp package's > +<**code>Client type has a new > method, > +Hello, > +which transmits a HELO or EHLO message (sic) to > the server. >
    • > >
  • > > > -- > > ---You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google > Groups "golang-dev" group. > To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an > email to golang-dev+unsubscribe@**googlegroups.com > . > For more options, visit https://groups.google.com/**groups/opt_out > . > > >

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=c868b3e02aa1 ***

doc/go1.1.html: net/mail, net/smtp

R=golang-dev, bradfitz
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/7835049
